UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020 families' resilience and coping mechanisms are strengthened and parents know about the importance of the early years

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020 gate-keeping mechanism in place to prevent children, particularly U3, from institutionalization

description.narrative: The CO supported a national, inter-sectoral dialogue on DI with special focus on children with disabilities and children U4. High level advocacy meetings coupled with presentation of case management piloting in Gomel oblast led to commitment from Government to develop a complex plan on DI for children and youth (2020-2023). Private sector engagement played critical role resulted in mobilizing resources. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/12/2019

title.narrative: Availability of improved legal provision stipulating the inter-agencies cooperation (including responsibilities and provision of integrated services) on assistance to vulnerable children and families at local level introducing set of indicators and risk assessment criteria

baseline.value: Current Regulation #47 of the MoE stipulates an out-dated practice and loose set of criteria to recognise the child being in social danger (2015). In 2017, revised regulation on support to children in

target.value: 2020:Existence of interagency plan on de-institutionalization and agreement by key stakeholders

actual.value: 2019:The case management technolgy has been piloted in Gomel region in 3 rayons. UNICEF and the Gomel regional athorities will start scale up of case management in 25 rayons in 2020.
